intro: Ophrys fuciflora f. tallosii, commonly known as the tallosii orchid, is a rare orchid species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a specialized lip that mimics the appearance of female insects to attract male pollinators. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in open habitats such as slopes and cliffs. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with intricate patterns that aid in pollination through mimicry. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
